title: Israel’s Gathering in Joy
html: Jacob promises great blessings of joy and salvation in 2 Nephi 8 and 9 as he cites three different Isaiah chapters. Continuing his discourse after quoting Isaiah 50 in 2 Nephi 7, Jacob quotes Isaiah 51 and the first two verses of chapter 52. There are four main sections in 2 Nephi 8: a reminder to Israel of her heritage and the Lord’s work (vv. 1–8); a promise that the righteous will enjoy the blessings of Zion (vv. 9–16); a warning and promise to the Jews in the last days (vv. 17–23); and a brief vision of Zion and Jerusalem restored to their full priesthood power (vv. 24–25). After quoting these Isaiah passages, Jacob builds upon them and delivers his profound sermon on the Atonement (2 Nephi 9). Toward the end of the sermon, Jacob quotes Isaiah 55:1–2 (2 Nephi 9:50–51), which becomes his invitation for all to come and partake of the blessings of the Redeemer’s salvation.
